page.title: 06Ancient Manor Site
page.content: The Manor of Upbury. Upbury or Beeches in the Parish of Pulloxhill is the site of the ancient 'out' manor of Pulloxhill. The estate can be traced back to the Domesday manor, part of the lands of which were acquired by Woburn, part by Dunstable, the rest being held by William de Faldho, the Buniun family and the Prior of St. John of Jerusalem. The manor house site is to the north of the village; at 187' nearly 160' below the average village height. The inner and outer moats are well preserved; still hold water and the fish ponds are still traceable. The manor site itself is much overgrown, the only trace of habitation are a few old tiles, broken pottery in the moat and some stone work where the entrance crossed the inner moats.
